    About

    I am a CS Graduate Student, specializing in Machine Learning at Georgia Institute of Technology. I am also a Graduate Teaching Assistant here for Machine Learning (CS 7641). I have coupled my Masters program with a research project Exploratory Video Analytics, advised by Prof. Joy Arulraj, where we are trying to build a Visual Database Management System that enables easy and efficient querying over videos.

    This summer I interned at Meta in the Creation ML team, where I had the opportunity to work end-to-end on ML pipelines, building and training large scale models for Music Recommendation used across Facebook for Stories and Reels. Prior to starting my Masters, I have worked in Machine Learning roles at Iron Mountain Insight and Samsung Research Institute Bangalore. I graduated from NIT-Trichy in 2018, where I received my B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering. Please head over to my resume or projects to know more about my work experiences.

    Interests

    I love Mathematics and solving challenging problem statements or puzzles. I always hope and strive to write clean, well-documented code. In the past 4 years of my academic and industry experience, I have worked with a good mix of Machine Learning, Systems and Cloud. In the next few years of my career, I want to explore and learn more along similar domains, building solutions that bridge research and industry.

    Work apart, I passionately follow and play Football/Cricket. I try to practice yoga regularly and truly believe being active and fit is essential for a well-functioning mind.
